trans-unit.source: Manage Employee Absence| Microsoft Docs
Describes how to record employees' absence and analyze absence statistics.
Manage Employee Absence
To manage an employee's absence, you must record the absence on the **Absence Registration** page.
It can then be viewed in different ways for analysis and reporting needs.
You can view employee absence in two different pages:
The **Absence Registration** page, where you register all employee absences with a line for each absence.
The **Employee Absences** page, where the absences for one employee only is shown.
This is the information that you entered on the **Absence Registration** page, filtered by the particular employee.
To obtain meaningful statistics, you should always use the same unit of measure (hour or day) when registering employee absences.
To register employee absence
You can register employee absences on a daily basis or at some other interval that meets your organizational needs.
In the top right corner, choose the **Search for Page or Report** icon, enter **Absence Registration**, and then choose the related link.
Choose the **New** action.
Fill in a line for each employee absence you want to register.
Close the page.
To obtain meaningful statistics, always use the same unit of measure, hour or day, when registering employee absences.
To view an individual employee's absence
In the top right corner, choose the **Search for Page or Report** icon, enter **Employees**, and then choose the related link.
Select the relevant employee, and then choose the **Absences** action.
The **Employee Absences** page opens showing all the absences and the date on which they started and ended.
To view an employee's absence by categories
In the top right corner, choose the **Search for Page or Report** icon, enter **Employees**, and then choose the related link.
Select the relevant employee, and then choose the **Absences by Categories** action.
On the **Empl. Absences by categories** page, fill in the filter fields as necessary, and then choose the **Show Matrix** action.
The **Empl. Absences by Cat. Matrix** page opens showing all absences, broken down by causes of absence.
To view all employee absences by category
In the top right corner, choose the **Search for Page or Report** icon, enter **Absence Registration**, and then choose the related link.
On the **Absence Registration** page, choose the **Overview by Categories** action.
On the **Absence Overview by Categories** page, set a filter in the **Employee No. Filter** field to view employee absences for individual or a defined group of employees.
Choose the **Show Matrix** action.
The **Absence Overview by Categories Matrix** page opens showing all employeesâ€™ absences broken down by the various causes of absence.
To view all employee absences by period
In the top right corner, choose the **Search for Page or Report** icon, enter **Absence Registration**, and then choose the related link.
On the **Absence Registration** page, choose the **Overview by Periods** action.
On the **Absence Overview by Periods** page, set a filter in the **Cause of Absence Filter** field to view employee absences for specified causes of absence.
Choose the **Show Matrix** action.
The **Abs. Overview by Periods Matrix** page opens showing employee absences broken down by periods.
